attributes.action: to make discrimination against obese people an offence
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Fatism is a term that describes hostile or oppressive behaviour towards people because they suffer from obesity. It is prevalent on British television, particularly in comedy viewing where it is deemed acceptable by Ofcom, the television regulatory board, to make jokes about a person’s weight.

Approximately two-thirds of the population is currently overweight or obese, and on present trends, obesity will soon surpass smoking as the greatest cause of premature loss of life. As a nation we don’t feel it’s acceptable to laugh at the suffering or side effects of cancer, and it shouldn’t be any different regarding the suffering or side effects of obesity, or any other weight-related illness. 

In recent decades, racism was also prevalent on British television, but public opinion forced a change. It is time for another change on television – this time regarding the treatment of people with weight-related illness. Accepting degrading behaviour towards these people promotes bullying and contributes to weight-related illnesses in society today.

Please sign this petition to make a change.
